tool.name: CruxAdapter
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out && mkdir database && ln -s '$database' 'database/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $database.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($database.ext)' &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("idxml")}' -database 'database/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $database.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($database.ext)'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("idxml")}' '$out' #if $adv_opts_cond.ctd_out_FLAG && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in
param.label: Input file

param.name: database
param.label: FASTA file

param.name: extra_index_args
param.label: Extra arguments to be passed to tide-index

param.name: extra_search_args
param.label: Extra arguments to be passed to tide-search

param.name: extra_percolator_args
param.label: Extra arguments to be passed to percolato

param.name: precursor_mass_tolerance
param.label: Precursor monoisotopic mass tolerance (Crux parameter: peptide_mass_tolerance)

param.name: precursor_mass_units
param.label: Unit of precursor mass tolerance (amu, m/z or ppm)

param.name: fragment_bin_offset
param.label: In the discretization of the m/z axes of the observed and theoretical spectra, this parameter specifies the location of the left edge of the first bin, relative to mass = 0
param.help: (i.e., mz-bin-offset = 0.xx means the left edge of the first bin will be located at +0.xx Da)

param.name: fragment_bin_width
param.label: Before calculation of the XCorr score, the m/z axes of the observed and theoretical spectra are discretized
param.help: This parameter specifies the size of each bin. The exact formula for computing the discretized m/z value is floor((x/mz-bin-width) + 1.0 - mz-bin-offset), where x is the observed m/z value. For low resolution ion trap ms/ms data 1.0005079 and for high resolution ms/ms 0.02 is recommended

param.name: isotope_error
param.label: List of positive, non-zero integers

param.name: run_percolator
param.label: Whether to run percolator after tide-search

param.name: enzyme
param.label: The enzyme used for peptide digestion

param.name: digestion
param.label: Full, partial or non specific digestion

param.name: allowed_missed_cleavages
param.label: Number of possible cleavage sites missed by the enzyme, maximum value is 5; for enzyme search

param.name: decoy_format
param.label: Decoy generation method either by reversing the sequence or shuffling it

param.name: keep_terminal_aminos
param.label: Whether to keep N and C terminal in place or also shuffled / reversed

param.name: cterm_modifications
param.label: Specifies C-terminal static and variable mass modifications on peptides
param.help: Specify a comma-separated list of C-terminal modification sequences of the form: X+21.9819 Default = <empty>

param.name: nterm_modifications
param.label: Specifies N-terminal static and variable mass modifications on peptides
param.help: Specify a comma-separated list of N-terminal modification sequences of the form: 1E-18.0106,C-17.0265 Default = <empty>

param.name: modifications
param.label: Expression for static and variable mass modifications to include
param.help: Specify a comma-separated list of modification sequences of the form: C+57.02146,2M+15.9949,1STY+79.966331,... Default = C+57.02146

param.name: test_fdr
param.label: False discovery rate threshold used in selecting hyperparameters during internal cross-validation and for reporting the final results

param.name: train_fdr
param.label: False discovery rate threshold to define positive examples in training

param.name: custom_enzyme
param.label: Specify rules for in silico digestion of protein sequences
param.help: Overrides the enzyme option. Two lists of residues are given enclosed in square brackets or curly braces and separated by a |. The first list contains residues required/prohibited before the cleavage site and the second list is residues after the cleavage site.

param.name: decoy_prefix
param.label: Specifies the prefix of the protein names that indicate a decoy

param.name: deisotope
param.label: Deisotope spectra before searching

param.name: report_decoys
param.label: Include decoys in the final reported dataset

param.name: force
param.label: Overwrite tool specific checks

param.name: ctd_out_FLAG
param.label: Output used ctd (ini) configuration file

tool.help:
Identifies MS/MS spectra using Crux.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/documentation/TOPP_CruxAdapter.html
